result.execSummary:
The defendant Francis A Schmitz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs ($268) and DNA surcharge ($250) are to be paid by 12-19-2014 or serve 11 days Huber as penalty for non payment of costs.

Court will allow the firearm to be released to Scott Schmitz within 10 days after the appellate time period has run (appellate process deadline is 09-10-2014).
If the firearm is not picked up within the time ordered by the court, the firearm maybe destroyed pursuant to statute.

Case 14CT570 was dismissed and read in.

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Francis A Schmitz in court with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.
State will also be requesting destruction of the firearm.

Defendant pleads No Contest to count 1.
Court finds the Defendant Guilty of count 1.

Court orders the following:
Costs:  $268
DNA Surcharge:  $250
To be paid by:  12/19/14
Alternate:  11 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard releases).
Court will allow the firearm to be released to Scott Schmitz within 10 days after the appellate time period has run (appellate process deadline is 09/10/14).
If the firearm is not picked up within the time ordered by the court the firearm maybe destroyed pursuant to statute.
Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Filed by the State.
